title: Configure audit gateway
content:
To configure the functional aspects of the audit gateway, you can change the values of the audit gateway configuration properties. You can override the default values of the audit gateway properties to suit your deployment needs. The default values are part of the audit gateway.

Audit gateway configuration properties

The following table provides the list of audit engine configuration properties:

Attribute Type Default value Description
auditUiConfigRefreshInterval Integer 300000 This attribute controls the time interval (in milliseconds) when audit gateway refreshes its configuration. Default value is 5 minutes.
auditUiIdmConnectTimeoutInterval Integer 1000 This attribute controls the time (in milliseconds) that the audit gateway waits when connecting to IdM before erroring out.
auditUiAuditSvcConnectTimeoutInterval Integer 3000 This attribute controls the time (in milliseconds) that the audit gateway waits when connecting to audit server before erroring out.
auditUiSupportedTlsProtocol String 1.2 and 1.3 The TLS protocol to use when establishing SSL connection.
auditUiSupportedCiphers String TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,
TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,
TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256,
TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,
TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384,
TLS_ECDHE_ECDSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384,
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256,
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA256,
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256,
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_CBC_SHA384,
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA256		 The ciphers to use when establishing SSL connections.

Generate an audit gateway configuration file

The default values provided in the aforementioned table can be overridden by creating a Kubernetes secret using a YAML file.

Perform the following steps on a control plane node (embedded Kubernetes deployments) or the bastion node (managed Kubernetes deployments).

  1. Create an audit_gateway_conf.yaml file with the following content. Example values are provided here. You can update the attribute values: 
    apiVersion: v1
kind: Secret
metadata:
  name: audit-gateway-cfg-secret
  namespace: <<namespace>>
type: Opaque
stringData:
  audit-gateway-cfg.properties: |
    auditUiConfigRefreshInterval=5000
    auditUiIdmConnectTimeoutInterval=1000
    auditUiAuditSvcConnectTimeoutInterval=1000
    auditUiSupportedTlsProtocol=1.2
    auditUiSupportedCiphers=TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
  2. After updating the template with custom values, create a secret by running the following command:
    kubectl apply -f audit_gateway_conf.yaml

You don't have to restart the audit gateway after you update the property values as it gets refreshed periodically. The default refresh interval is 5 minutes but you can configure this.
